Ice::

She drifted in and out of consiousness. She lay on her side, feeling 
the soft snow fall onto her white fur. She starting to feel cold, for 
the first time.  She had lost a lot of blood and was now feeiling the 
effects of it. She could see her breath in the cold air. 

She then thought she caught a scent on the wind. It reminded her of 
Lunarpine. But she thought her tired mind was playing tricks on her. 
She closed her eyes and fell unconsious in the snow. Just on the 
other side of the ice field. 


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Lunarpine pressed on through the snow and ice, he found a fresh 
trail of
> blood on the ground. He picked up Ice's scent and continued 
forward. He came
> upon what appeared to be a frozen river. he could see a hole in it. 
He
> feared the worst, if she fell in it could spread the virus even 
faster. He
> contacted Veratis hoping the old bot would put his fears to rest.
> 
> "No sign of the virus in the water." Veratis said with a sigh of 
relief.
> He'd lost her on his scanners but could still give Lunarpine a 
direction to
> head in in order to find her and bring her back.He hoped she was 
only a
> carrier and not a victim. Veratis knew that Lunarpines body was 
immune to
> the virus, unless it had mutated inside Ice.
> 
> Lunarpine was relieved at the close call, he again transformed, 
this time
> into his half wolf stage and began moving. He'd lost a little speed 
but
> gained strength which caused him to move a little faster, he could 
force his
> way through the snow more easily than run through. He howled to the 
sky
> hoping Ice would get the message and come home. He missed Shadow 
Wing. He
> didn't get to know Ice, and now he might never get the chance. He 
might have
> shed a tear if the freezing winds hadn't frozen his ducts. This was 
like he
> remembered his crash site was like in northern canada. A frozen 
wonderland
> where he'd met her, now it was his turn to search for her, He was 
glad, he never thought he'd have the chance again.
